Most wellness advice wasn’t made for women. In fact, following it might be the reason you’re not seeing results !!! For the last 5 years, I’ve been cross-referencing research to make sure the advice we follow actually applies to us, ladies.

Here are 5 trends that are bs 👇

❌ Trend #1: Intermittent Fasting every day!

Women’s bodies are more sensitive to energy deficits. Daily fasting can lower kisspeptin—a molecule that regulates GnRH → LH/FSH → ovulation.
Translation? You could suppress your cycle, slow your metabolism, and increase belly fat.

✅ Better: Fast in your follicular phase. How? More on that in my cycle syncing @bestie.app! 
📚 Harvard Med (2013)

❌ Trend #2: Ice Baths

Cold plunges are great for dopamine… but timing matters.
In menstruating women, constant cold exposure activates norepinephrine and cortisol → can lead to adrenal fatigue over time if you’re already stressed, under-eating, or over-training.

✅ Better: Cold exposure 1–2x/week in your follicular phase, not every day. In luteal? Prioritize heat therapy (saunas, baths, walking outside).
📚 Kregel et al., 2002:

❌ Trend #3: Replacing Meals with Green Juice

Uncooked cruciferous veggies like raw kale and broccoli contain goitrogens—that inhibit iodine uptake, which can reduce thyroid hormone production (extra fat storage!)

✅ Better: lightly cook your greens—this reduces goitrogens by up to 80%. (Also in my @bestie.app!!!)
📚 Rose et al., 1995 and Gunnars, 2013

❌ Trend #4: Low-Fat Everything

Your hormones are literally built from cholesterol.
Going too low-fat = your body can’t produce enough estrogen, progesterone, or cortisol and worsen PMS.

✅ Better: Eat fats from egg yolks, grass-fed butter, fatty fish, and olive oil. Especially critical in luteal phase.
📚 Wang et al., 2000:

❌ Trend #5: HIIT & running

Daily HIIT depletes progesterone, which worsens PMS, sleep, and even fat loss resistance. Plus it leads to type 2 muscle fiber burnout—these are your power, strength, and longevity fibers.

✅ Better: Lift heavy in your follicular and ovulatory phases. Walk, stretch, or do Pilates luteally. Train like a woman in my @bestie.app —not like a bootcamp bro.

📚 Tomiyama, 2012
